results.title: Falstaff
results.creator_credit: Covent Garden Video Productions, Los Angeles Philharmonic Association, Teatro Comunale, Florence, BBC-TV, Roanld Eyre and Brian Large
results.brief_description: Falstaff is an opera in three acts by Giuseppe Verdi, with libretto by Arrigo Boito from Shakespeare’s plays, The Merry Wives of Windsor and Henry IV. It was Verdi’s last opera, written at an advanced age, and is noted for its concluding fugue, “Tutto nel mondo e burla” (“All the world’s a joke”). This made for television production was performed at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden by the Royal Opera, directed by Sir John Tooley and featuring the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Carlo Maria Giulini and the Royal Opera Chorus led by Chorus master John McCarthy. Renato Bruson is brilliant in the role of Sir John Falstaff as are the rest of the leading singers including Dalmacio Gonzalez (Fenton), Brenda Boozer (Meg Page), Barbara Hendricks (Nanetta), Lucia Valentini-Terrani (Mistress Quickly), Leo Nucci (Ford) and Katia Ricciarelli (Alice Ford). Realistic stage sets by Hayden Griffin and period costumes by Michael Stennett, along with the wonderful atmosphere of the Royal Opera House, set the mood of the time. Sung in Italian with no English subtitles. Includes booklet with English translation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Covent Garden Video Productions, Los Angeles Philharmonic Association, Teatro Comunale, Florence, BBC-TV, Roanld Eyre and Brian Large

results.title: False note
results.brief_description: An animated story of a pathetic organ-grinder who cannot play an entire song without striking a sour note. He wanders through a city filled with neon signs, sleek automobiles, bank note collages, and humanoid figures, searching for a sympathetic response. The city’s indifference merges into hostility and the little musician is left only with his dreams. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Falling from ladders
results.creator_credit: Svenska filminstitutet, ONF | NFB, John Kemeny, Tom Daly, Joseph Koenig and Mort Ransen
results.brief_description: Simply by putting about twenty Swedish men, women and young people in front of his camera and having them read aloud from the Statistical Year Book, filmmaker Mort Ransen has recorded a wide range of impressions of Sweden’s economic and social existence. Quotations vary from the whole gamut of exports and imports, marriages formed or dissolved, to the number of people who fall from ladders annually.

results.title: Falling down
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Arnold Kopelson, Herschel Weingrod, Timothy Harris and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: On a hot, steaming day in Los Angeles Bill Foster (Michael Douglas) leaves his car in a traffic jam and walks through a violent, scarred city on his way home to find his estranged wife (Barbara Hershey). His attempt to go home finds him confronting an urban landscape devastated by random violence and extreme poverty. Foster, who has believed in the American Dream of wealth, patriotism and dignified labour, finds that only through violence is he able to have his voice heard. The subject of acute controversy when released, “Falling Down” does not slot easily into the vigilante genre. Our identification with Foster is constantly undermined by the accelerating pathology of his behaviour. This film eludes either liberal or conservative readings. What it reflects is a society not on the brink of chaos, but one in which disintegration is the norm. Robert Duvall is the cop on Foster’s trail and there is a frightening, intense cameo by Frederic Forrest as an all-American neo-Nazi.

results.title: Fallen angels
results.creator_credit: Jet Tone Production, Jeff Lau and Wong
results.brief_description: Fallen Angels is another breathtaking film from Hong Kong director Wong Kar Wai. The film stylishly weaves the stories of a group of characters who traverse Hong Kong city by night. Wong Chi-Ming (Leon Lai) is a hired killer. His partner is an un-named woman (Michelle Reis) whom he has never seen. A young man who doesn’t speak (Takeshi Kaneshiro) videos his father in their tiny Hong Kong flat. Hong Kong, the city, is itself a ‘character’ in the strange meanderings of the stories. Wong Kar Wai (together with Australian cinematographer Chris Doyle) creates a visually stunning, edgy style which none the less is as much about the characters drawn together as cinematic effects. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Fallen
results.creator_credit: Turner Pictures, Atlas Entertainment, Charles Rover, Dawn Steel and Gregory Hoblit
results.brief_description: High budget supernatural thriller that sees Joe Hobbs (Denzel Washington) witness the execution of a serial killer. Things take a menacing turn when identical murders take place. It appears that a demon is passing through humans possessing them thus enabling the killer to continue with his murdering. Taunting the detective a twist at the end keeps the drama gripping. Police drama meets supernatural thriller. Cast includes John Goodman, Donald Sutherland and James Gandolfini.

results.title: Fall line
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Bob Carmichael and Greg Lowe
results.brief_description: An exciting film of the high risk sport of extreme skiing. On a peak in Wyoming’s Grand Tetons a lone skier attempts the first climb and then the fall line - a breathtaking descent of the almost vertical slope. Awarded first prize, Sports, San Francisco International Film Festival. The skier is Steve Shea and the film has been narrated by Ron Hayes.

results.title: Fall-line
results.brief_description: Compares the similarities of handling body movement in four sports which have been made posible by new technology: skateboarding, surfing, skiing and hang gliding. Additional script material by Bert Deling.

results.title: Falklands: the story
results.brief_description: British whaling stations and meteorological outposts have operated in the Falklands for the past 40 years, but recently Argentina and Chile claimed the Islands on the basis of their geographical proximity.
